page.title: 14DELIVERY SERVICES OF ALKHAM
page.content: With no local shop the people in the Alkham area rely heavily on the services of Mr. W. Wenham, a well known local figure. Officially he is the milkman but his services are more diverse than this. For fourteen years he has delivered milk every other day to 234 households, charging 15p a week delivery because of the scattered nature of his round. He also regularly delivers bread, free-range eggs, obtained from local farms, and cheese. He collects his milk from Northern Dairies, Folkestone and bread is left for him on the roadside in South Alkham. On Friday he collects 2O grocery order books from pensioners in the area without cars and delivers all their goods the following Wednesday. He also collects and delivers prescriptions and undertakes gardening for several residents.
